docs.title: Django PDF Export
docs.text: A powerful Django application that adds PDF export capabilities to your Django admin interface. Export your model data to beautifully formatted PDF documents with customizable layouts, fonts, and styling.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Django PDF Export adds PDF export capabilities to your Django admin interface with support for:

  • Multiple orientations (portrait and landscape)
  • Customizable fonts and styling
  • Configurable layouts
  • Unicode text support (including Arabic)
  • Header and footer customization
  • Logo integration
  • Table styling and formatting
  • And much more...

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
• 🎨 Fully Customizable: Control fonts, colors, margins, and layout settings
  • 📱 Responsive Design: Both portrait and landscape orientations supported
  • 🌐 Unicode Support: Full support for non-Latin characters including Arabic text
  • 🎯 Easy Integration: Simple setup with Django admin actions
  • ⚙️ Configurable Settings: Manage export settings through the admin interface
  • 🔧 Extensible: Easy to extend and customize for your needs
  • 📄 Multiple Formats: Support for both portrait and landscape layouts
  • 🎉 Modern UI: Clean and professional PDF output

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• Python 3.8+
  • Django 3.2+
  • ReportLab 4.0+
  • django-model-utils 5.0+

docs.title: Quick Installation
docs.text:
pip install django-pdf-actions

Add to your INSTALLED_APPS:

INSTALLED_APPS = [
    ...
    'django_pdf_actions',
]

Run migrations:

python manage.py migrate

docs.title: Basic Usage
docs.text:
Add PDF export actions to your admin class:

from django.contrib import admin
from django_pdf_actions.actions import export_to_pdf_landscape, export_to_pdf_portrait

@admin.register(YourModel)
class YourModelAdmin(admin.ModelAdmin):
    actions = [export_to_pdf_landscape, export_to_pdf_portrait]

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before installing Django PDF Export, ensure you have:

  • Python 3.8 or higher
  • Django 3.2 or higher
  • pip (Python package installer)

docs.title: Using pip (Recommended)
docs.text:
The easiest way to install Django PDF Export is using pip:

pip install django-pdf-actions

docs.title: From Source
docs.text:
If you want to install the latest development version:

git clone https://github.com/ibrahimroshdy/django-pdf-actions.git
cd django-pdf-actions
pip install -e .

docs.title: 1. Add to INSTALLED_APPS
docs.text:
Add 'django_pdf_actions' to your INSTALLED_APPS in settings.py:

INSTALLED_APPS = [
    ...
    'django_pdf_actions',
]

docs.title: 2. Run Migrations
docs.text:
Apply the database migrations:

python manage.py migrate

docs.title: 3. Set up Fonts (Optional)
docs.text:
Set up the default fonts:

python manage.py setup_fonts

docs.title: Verify Installation
docs.text:
To verify the installation:

  1. Start your Django development server
  2. Navigate to the Django admin interface
  3. Select any model with list view
  4. You should see "Export to PDF (Portrait)" and "Export to PDF (Landscape)" in the actions dropdown

docs.title: Quick Start Guide
docs.text: This guide will help you get started with Django PDF Export quickly.

docs.title: 1. Install the Package
docs.text: pip install django-pdf-actions

docs.title: 2. Update INSTALLED_APPS
docs.text:
Add to your Django settings:

INSTALLED_APPS = [
    ...
    'django_pdf_actions',
]

docs.title: 3. Run Migrations
docs.text: python manage.py migrate

docs.title: 1. Import Actions
docs.text:
In your admin.py:

from django.contrib import admin
from django_pdf_actions.actions import export_to_pdf_landscape, export_to_pdf_portrait

docs.title: 2. Add to ModelAdmin
docs.text:
@admin.register(YourModel)
class YourModelAdmin(admin.ModelAdmin):
    list_display = ('id', 'name', 'created_at')  # Your fields
    actions = [export_to_pdf_landscape, export_to_pdf_portrait]

docs.title: Basic Usage
docs.text:
1. Go to your model's list view in Django admin
  2. Select the records you want to export
  3. Choose either:
  4. "Export to PDF (Portrait)"
  5. "Export to PDF (Landscape)"
  6. Click "Go"
  7. Your PDF will download automatically

docs.title: 1. Create Export Settings
docs.text:
1. Go to Admin > Django PDF > Export PDF Settings
  2. Click "Add Export PDF Settings"
  3. Configure basic settings: 
    {
    'title': 'My Export Settings',
    'header_font_size': 12,
    'body_font_size': 8,
    'page_margin_mm': 20,
    'items_per_page': 15
}
  4. Mark as active
  5. Save

docs.title: 2. Test the Export
docs.text:
1. Go to your model's admin list view
  2. Select a few records
  3. Try both portrait and landscape exports

docs.title: PDF Export Settings
docs.text: Django PDF Export provides a comprehensive set of settings that can be configured through the Django admin interface.

docs.title: Page Layout Settings
docs.text: Setting Description Default Range items_per_page Number of rows per page 10 1-50 page_margin_mm Page margins in millimeters 15 5-50 header_height_mm Header height in millimeters 20 10-50 footer_height_mm Footer height in millimeters 15 10-50

docs.title: Font Settings
docs.text: Setting Description Default Range font_name TTF font file name DejaVuSans.ttf Any TTF header_font_size Header text size 10 6-24 body_font_size Body text size 7 6-18

docs.title: Table Settings
docs.text: Setting Description Default Range table_spacing Cell padding in millimeters 1.5 0.5-5.0 table_line_height Row height multiplier 1.2 1.0-2.0 table_header_height Header row height 30 20-50 max_chars_per_line Maximum characters per line 50 30-100

docs.title: Visual Settings
docs.text: Setting Description Default header_background_color Header background color #F0F0F0 grid_line_color Table grid line color #000000 grid_line_width Grid line thickness 0.25

docs.title: Display Options
docs.text: Setting Description Default show_header Display page header True show_logo Display company logo True show_export_time Show export timestamp True show_page_numbers Show page numbers True

docs.title: Configuration Example
docs.text:
Here's an example of how to configure the settings through the Django admin interface:

  1. Navigate to Admin > Django PDF > Export PDF Settings
  2. Click "Add Export PDF Settings"
  3. Configure your settings: 
    {
    'title': 'Default Export Settings',
    'active': True,
    'header_font_size': 12,
    'body_font_size': 8,
    'page_margin_mm': 20,
    'items_per_page': 15,
    'table_spacing': 2.0,
    'show_logo': True,
    'show_page_numbers': True
}
  4. Save your settings

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Only one configuration can be active at a time
  • Changes take effect immediately
  • Font files must be in the correct directory
  • Colors should be in hexadecimal format (#RRGGBB)
